snippet.textDisplay: This song defines, in my humble opinion, the perfect "reaching the final leg of the journey" music. Its calm, almost hypnotically tranquil, with that beat, the "thrum", the strings and woodwinds... then it suddenly picks up into adventuring music again! Its just beautiful. I love you Breath of Fire games, I love you.
snippet.textOriginal: This song defines, in my humble opinion, the perfect "reaching the final leg of the journey" music. Its calm, almost hypnotically tranquil, with that beat, the "thrum", the strings and woodwinds... then it suddenly picks up into adventuring music again! Its just beautiful. I love you Breath of Fire games, I love you.

snippet.textDisplay: @Taylor Beck Well I know for a fact that BoF2 is in the Nintendo E-shop. I don't even think they have BoF1, but I could be wrong. The games aren't really canonical so really you can play them in any order you wish. The only real mention of canon is a single line of dialogue in BoF2 related to BoF1. If you can, I'd almost say hunt down BoF3 or 4 because those have probably the greatest plots.
snippet.textOriginal: @Taylor Beck Well I know for a fact that BoF2 is in the Nintendo E-shop. I don't even think they have BoF1, but I could be wrong. The games aren't really canonical so really you can play them in any order you wish. The only real mention of canon is a single line of dialogue in BoF2 related to BoF1. If you can, I'd almost say hunt down BoF3 or 4 because those have probably the greatest plots.

snippet.textDisplay: @SolstaceWinters Cool man, thanks for the replies :) I'll definitely check one out. Looks like some of em are on or are coming to virtual console, so maybe I'll check it out on there. Or I could hunt down the cartridge and fire up the ol' SNES haha
snippet.textOriginal: @SolstaceWinters Cool man, thanks for the replies :) I'll definitely check one out. Looks like some of em are on or are coming to virtual console, so maybe I'll check it out on there. Or I could hunt down the cartridge and fire up the ol' SNES haha

snippet.textDisplay:
Honestly, they are all fun! BoF 1, 3, and 4 were amazing bloody games. 1 Is a great old-school RPG. BoF3 is my all-time favorite of the 5 games, and has the best story, humor, RPG-elements, music, everything! BoF4 is also a great story, music, and all of that (I just like BoF3 a little better), but where BoF3 has a more japanese feel, BoF4 is decidedly chinese. Give any of them a whirl.

BoF1 - SNES, GBA
BoF2 - SNES, GBA
BoF3 - PS1
BoF4 - PS1
BoF5 - PS2
snippet.textOriginal:
Honestly, they are all fun! BoF 1, 3, and 4 were amazing bloody games. 1 Is a great old-school RPG. BoF3 is my all-time favorite of the 5 games, and has the best story, humor, RPG-elements, music, everything! BoF4 is also a great story, music, and all of that (I just like BoF3 a little better), but where BoF3 has a more japanese feel, BoF4 is decidedly chinese. Give any of them a whirl.

BoF1 - SNES, GBA
BoF2 - SNES, GBA
BoF3 - PS1
BoF4 - PS1
BoF5 - PS2

snippet.textDisplay: This game is good. Its battle system takes some getting used to if you don't play a mixture of both Real Time and Strategy RPG's. And its a BIG TIME departure from what Breath of Fire was when it started. But overall, this is CAPCOM firing on all cylinders and REALLY doing some of their better work.
snippet.textOriginal: This game is good. Its battle system takes some getting used to if you don't play a mixture of both Real Time and Strategy RPG's. snippet.textDisplay: you're feeling a very positive feeling of hearing a song that you enjoy a lot.  hearing it may have triggered something in your mind to make you think back to something that happened in the past that was really good. we really never forget anything that happens to us or anything that we see or do. it's always there. we just need some help getting the memories back. this song helped to bring a good feeling back to you. you can't remember exactly what it is but it brought it close to you.
